text:
possible but with static blog recent posts
but it does not make sense too
copy and paste module snippet inside body text, save and reload the page, you'll find the custom module on the left side bar where you can edit its content
Thanks, <@UV23JHEJY>. Does this affect on whole template or just on single post?
just on a single post, so you can add different modules on different posts, if you need it on every post add it directly on the template outside of the body text
How can we convert global modules to local modules?
through the CLI, same as converting local to global, you have to change the global value from true to false
I'm not sure what that would do if the module is in use across multiple pages, I assume it would make each module's content independent again

I’m trying to implement and invoicing feature in HubSpot,

I want to create a customer portal where a customer can log in and pay their invoices. The way I’ve been thing about implementing this is by creating a dynamic page that has CRM data associated with that customer in it (including invoices stored as “deals” in the CRM) and then assigning a membership for each customer to their dynamic page.

Is this a good way to go about it or does anyone have any suggestions?

Hi , I am trying to add an email subscription form, but it does not generate html markup `{% module "blog_subscribe" path="@HubSpot/blog_subscribe" title="subscribe" select_blog="blog-test"	%}`   where blog-test is the name of the blog. I have seen <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/blog-subscribe-HTML-markup-is-not-generated/td-p/575597> but this show's only a solution with the design manager, which I haven't used
